front.title: Simple Provisioning of Public Names for Residential Networks

abstract.t: Home network owners often have devices and services that they wish to access outside their home network - i.e., from the Internet using their names. To do so, these names need to be made publicly available in the DNS. This document describes how a Homenet Naming Authority (HNA) can instruct a DNS Outsourcing Infrastructure (DOI) to publish a Public Homenet Zone on its behalf.
